revised_title: The Colour-Physiology of Higher Crustacea: Part III
tldr: The authors study the histology and physiology of chromatophores in higher crustaceans, specifically Hippolyte and Crangon. They describe the distribution, pigments, and reflecting substances within the chromatophores and their development in both adult and larval stages. The research also explores the relationship between different pigments and their response to light stimuli.
